questions.question: Are you not ashamed ……………………?
questions.description: Ashamed is used with of the reflexive pronoun is used when the subject and the object refer to the same person.

questions.question: When we lived in Bangalore, we …………………….. go out every evening.
questions.description: Both would and used to can be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: The room was ............................. dark that I couldn’t see anything.
…………………….. had I finished reading one book, when I started another.
………………… he was suffering from fever, he didn’t go out.
questions.description: As is used to give the reason.

questions.question: This is the house …………………… he lives.
He asked me …………………….. I had finished.
questions.description: Both if and whether can be used to introduce an indirect question.

questions.question: Iron as well as coal ……………………… found in India.
questions.description: When we connect two singular nouns with as well as, the verb should be singular.

questions.question: He has been learning English ………………………. 5 years.
Even if you invited him, he ……………………….. come.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: ……………………. the cops, the thieves ran away.
If I were the Prime Minister, I ………………........... capital punishment.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.
